variant.question: On take-off from an un-balanced field you have an available range of V~1~ speeds. What would happen if a higher V~1~ was selected from the range?

options.text: The all engine take-off distance will be unaffected.
Both TOD and ASD will increase.
The ASDR will decrease.
Both TOD and ASD will decrease.

variant.question: What are the effects of using a clearway on both the Allowed Take-Off Mass and the associated V1 The Allowed Take-Off Mass?

options.text: increases and V1 decreases.
decreases and V1 increases.
and V1 decrease.
and V1 increase.

variant.question: Compared with a balanced field with no stopway or clearway, the use of a stopway in the take-off calculations allows to...

options.text: increase the Take-Off Mass, and increase the V1.
decrease the Take-Off Mass, and increase the V1.
decrease the Take-Off Mass, and decrease the V1.
increase the Take-Off Mass, and decrease the V1.

variant.question: Compared with a balanced field with no stopway or clearway, the use of a stopway in the take-off calculations allows to..

options.text: increase the Take-Off Mass, and increase the V~1~.
decrease the Take-Off Mass, and decrease the V~1~.
decrease the Take-Off Mass, and increase the V~1~.
increase the Take-Off Mass, and decrease the V~1~.

variant.question: On take-off from an un-balanced field you have an available range of V1s. If a higher V1 is selected from the range then:

options.text: The all engine take-off distance will be unaffected.
The ASDR will decrease.
Both TOD and ASD will increase.
Both TOD and ASD will decrease.

variant.question: When compared to a balanced condition, taking into account a Stopway leads to a...

options.text: higher Take-Off Mass and increased V1.
lower Take-Off Mass and increased V1.
higher Take-Off Mass and decreased V1.
lower Take-Off Mass and decreased V1.

variant.question: If the V1 and FLLTOM have been calculated using the balanced field technique what will be the influence on V1 and the FLLTOM if the clearway is increased?

options.text: V1 decreases, TOM increases.
V1 increases, TOM increases.
V1 increases, TOM decreases.
V1 constant, TOM increases.

variant.question: If the V1 and FLLTOM have been calculated using the balanced field technique what will be the influence on V1 and the FLLTOM if the stopway is increased?

options.text: V1 increases, FLLTOM increases.
V1 decreases, FLLTOM increases.
V1 increases, FLLTOM decreases.
V1 increases, FLLTOM remains constant..

variant.question: Compared to a balanced field with no stopway or clearway, adding a stopway will ___ the performance limited takeoff mass and ___ V~1~.

options.text: increase; increase
decrease; increase
decrease; decrease
increase; decrease

variant.question: Explain the effect of a stopway/clearway on the allowed take-off mass and appropriate V1 when using an unbalanced field.

options.text: If there is a stopway and no clearway the take-off mass can be higher than the balanced field take-off mass, and the appropriate V1 needs to be higher than V1balanced.
If there is a clearway and no stopway the take-off mass can be higher than the balanced field take-off mass, and the appropriate V1 needs to be higher than V1balanced.
If there is a clearway and no stopway the take-off mass must be lower than the balanced field take-off mass, and the appropriate V1 needs to be higher than V1 balanced.
If there is a stopway and no clearway the take-off mass must be lower than the balanced field take-off mass, and the appropriate V1 needs to be lower than V1balanced.

variant.question: If the field-length-limited take-off mass and V~1~ were calculated using balanced field-lengths, the use of any additional clearway in the calculation would cause:

options.text: an increased field-length-limited take-off mass and a reduced V~1~.
an increased obstacle-limited take-off mass and an increased V~1~.
an increased field-length-limited take-off mass and an increased V~1~.
an increased obstacle-limited take-off mass with the same V~1~.

variant.question: If the field-length-limited take-off mass and V~1~ were calculated using balanced field-lengths, the use of any additional clearway in the calculation would cause:

options.text: an increased field-length-limited take-off mass and a reduced V1.
an increased obstacle-limited take-off mass with the same V1.
an increased field-length-limited take-off mass and an increased V1.
an increased obstale-limited take-off mass and an increased V1.

variant.question: What is the advantage of balancing V1, even in the event of a climb limited take-off?

options.text: The safety margin with respect to the runway length is greatest.
The accelerate stop distance required is the shortest.
The take-off distance required with one engine out at V1 is the shortest.
The climb limited Take-off Mass is the highest.

variant.question: What is the advantage of balanced V1, even in the event of a climb limited take-off?

options.text: The safety margin with respect to the runway length is greatest.
The climb limited take-off mass is the highest.
The take-off distance required with one engine out at V1 is the shortest.
The accelerate stop distance required is the shortest.

variant.question: Comparing a balanced field with an unbalanced field with the use of available clearway, but NO stopway, what is the effect on the Field-Length-Limited Take-Off Mass (FLTOM) and the associated V1? The FLTOM...

options.text: increases and V1 decreases.
decreases and V1 increases.
increases and V1 increases.
decreases and V1 decreases.

variant.question: What happens to V~1~ and the ASDR if a stopway is added to a balanced runway?

options.text: V~1~ increases and the ASDR increases.
V~1~ remains the same and the ASDR decreases.
V~1~ increases and the ASDR remains the same.
V~1~ decreases and the ASDR increases.
